nodes.name: project
nodes.description: Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. (NCIt C47885)

properties.name: availability_type
properties.description: Is the project open or restricted?

properties.name: awg_review
properties.description: Indicates that the project is an AWG project.

properties.name: code
properties.description: Project code

properties.name: dbgap_accession_number
properties.description: The dbgap accession number for the project.

properties.name: disease_type
properties.description: Full name for the project

properties.name: intended_release_date
properties.description: Tracks a Project's intended release date.

properties.name: in_review
properties.description: Indicates that the project is under review by the submitter. Upload and data modification is disabled.

properties.name: is_legacy
properties.description: Indicates whether a project will appear in the Legacy Archive.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Display name for the project

properties.name: primary_site
properties.description: Primary site for the project

properties.name: release_requested
properties.description: User requests that the GDC release the project. Release can only be requested if the project is releasable.

properties.name: released
properties.description: To release a project is to tell the GDC to include all submitted entities in the next GDC index.

properties.name: releasable
properties.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.

properties.name: request_submission
properties.description: Indicates that the user has requested submission to the GDC for harmonization.

properties.name: submission_enabled
properties.description: Indicates if submission to a project is allowed.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'project' table.

nodes.name: dataset
nodes.description: A collection or set of metadata and associated data file objects originating from a single research study, clinical trial or patient cohort.

properties.name: acknowledgement
properties.description: Publication acknowledgement(s) for the published dataset.

properties.name: collection_id
properties.description: A unique identifier for the dataset.

properties.name: data_citation
properties.description: The citation for the published dataset.

properties.name: data_contributor
properties.description: The name of the organization or individual that the contributed dataset belongs to.

properties.name: data_description
properties.description: A brief, free-text description of the data files and associated metadata provided for this dataset.

properties.name: data_url_doi
properties.description: A URL or DOI for the source of the dataset or the contributing organization's website.

properties.name: disease_type
properties.description: The primary type of disease studied in this dataset, if applicable.

properties.name: full_name
properties.description: The full name or title of the dataset or publication.

properties.name: license
properties.description: The license under which the daaset has been published.

properties.name: longitudinal
properties.description: Indicates whether the dataset has longitudinal or time-series data.

properties.name: primary_site
properties.description: The primary body site studied in this dataset.

properties.name: publication_citation
properties.description: The major or main publication(s) associated with the data itself or with the publication that published the dataset.

properties.name: research_description
properties.description: If the dataset is related to a research study, provide a brief, free-text description or abstract of the study being performed, for example, the hypothesis being tested and a very brief description of the materials, methods and results.

properties.name: research_design
properties.description: A summary of the goals of the research or a general description of the research's relationship to a clinical application.

properties.name: research_objective
properties.description: The general objective of the research; what the researchers hope to discover or determine.

properties.name: research_setup
properties.description: A high level description of the setup used to achieve the research objectives.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'dataset' table.

properties.name: dataset.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'dataset' table.

nodes.name: subject
nodes.description: The collection of all data related to a specific patient, case, or subject in the context of a specific dataset or experiment, including demographics.

properties.name: MRN
properties.description: Medical Record Number

properties.name: Last_Name
properties.description: Last Name

properties.name: First_Name
properties.description: First Name

properties.name: Date_of_Birth
properties.description: Date of Birth

properties.name: Sex_Desc
properties.description: Subject's sex

properties.name: Race_1_Desc
properties.description: Subject's race

properties.name: Spanish_Hispanic_Origin_Desc
properties.description: Subject's sex

properties.name: Primary_Payer_at_DX_Desc
properties.description: Insurance paying at time of diagnosis

properties.name: Class_of_Case_Desc
properties.description: Class of case description

properties.name: Date_of_Last_Contact
properties.description: date last contact was made with the patient

properties.name: Vital_Status_Desc
properties.description: if patient is dead or alive aka survival status

properties.name: Cancer_Status_Desc
properties.description: if at date of last contact patient has evidence of the tumor referred to in the rest of this row, aka if they are disease free or not

properties.name: Date_First_Recurrence
properties.description: date of recurrences

properties.name: Type_First_Recurrence_Desc
properties.description: type of recurrences

properties.name: Cause_of_Death_Desc
properties.description: if death was cancer related, due to other causes, or unknown

properties.name: CancerRegistry_PatientID
properties.description: Patient ID in the Cancer Registry. Has been censored in this dataset

properties.name: pt_name
properties.description: patient first & last name (removed for toy dataset)

properties.name: gender
properties.description: male or female

properties.name: race
properties.description: patient race

properties.name: Ethnicity
properties.description: hispanic or latino origin

properties.name: date_of_death
properties.description: patients only have if deceased and is manually recorded by staff, some death dates are unknown

properties.name: zip_code
properties.description: patient home zip code, censored for toy dataset

properties.name: dataset.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'dataset' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'subject' table.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'subject' table.

nodes.name: sample
nodes.description: Any biological or material sample used for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions.

properties.name: protocol_number
properties.description: The protocol number for the sample, e.g., '8980'.

properties.name: procedure_date
properties.description: date/time of sample collection or reception at the HTRC

properties.name: sample_number
properties.description: Sample ID unique to specific sample. Newer samples begin with S, older samples do not.

properties.name: status
properties.description: status of sample within HTRC. In Circulation is the best, it means that sample is actively banked at HTRC.

properties.name: sample_type
properties.description: The type of sample (plasma, serum, DNA, whole blood, unstained slide, FFPE tissue, OCT tissue)

properties.name: body_fluid_code
properties.description: Designates which tubes samples were collected in

properties.name: sample_volume
properties.description: volume of sample in milliliters

properties.name: dna_concentration
properties.description: metrics collected during DNA isolation

properties.name: dna_260_280
properties.description: The ratio of absorbance at 260 nm and 280 nm; used to assess the purity of nucleic acid sample.

properties.name: dna_od_260
properties.description: The optical density of a nucleic acid sample measured at a wavelength of 260 nm; for determining the concentration of nucleic acid samples.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

properties.name: dataset.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'dataset' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'sample' table.

nodes.name: cytology_report
nodes.description: Cytology reports & results from cytologists reviewing specimens collected during fine needle aspirations; used for diagnosis.

properties.name: enc_date
properties.description: encounter date

properties.name: adm_date
properties.description: admission date

properties.name: disc_date
properties.description: discharge date

properties.name: order_dttm
properties.description: day/time order was put in

properties.name: result_dttm
properties.description: day/time results/note were completed

properties.name: Order_proc_id
properties.description: unique order ID

properties.name: proc_code
properties.description: code and description of surgical pathology procedure

properties.name: proc_desc
properties.description: code and description of surgical pathology procedure

properties.name: lab_code
properties.description: code and description of surgical pathology lab

properties.name: lab_desc
properties.description: code and description of surgical pathology lab

properties.name: path_value
properties.description: unused

properties.name: path_note
properties.description: raw text note of pathology report

properties.name: result_in_range_yn
properties.description: flag to denote if the result is in range

properties.name: result_flag
properties.description: flag to denote if the result is abnormal

properties.name: reference_unit
properties.description: reference unit of the result

properties.name: HPV
properties.description: flag to denote if HPV or P16 are mentioned in raw text. Used to identify patients who HPV/p16 result or status

properties.name: P16
properties.description: flag to denote if HPV or P16 are mentioned in raw text. Used to identify patients who HPV/p16 result or status

properties.name: accession_num
properties.description: accession number used to identify the cytology report/cytologist review

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'cytology_report' table.

properties.name: cytology_report.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'cytology_report' table.

nodes.name: vitals_flowsheet
nodes.description: Vitals flowsheets track vital signs over a period of time, allowing healthcare providers to observe trends and patterns in vital signs.

properties.name: pat_enc_csn_id
properties.description: unique ID for patient encounter, unsure what CSN is

properties.name: flo_meas_id
properties.description: ID and name of measurement

properties.name: flo_meas_name
properties.description: ID and name of measurement

properties.name: device_id
properties.description: ID corresponding to device which recorded measurement

properties.name: recorded_time
properties.description: time of recording, appears to be not used

properties.name: meas_value
properties.description: value corresponding to measurement

properties.name: meas_location
properties.description: location of measurement

properties.name: flo_group_name
properties.description: group name for flowsheet measurement. Looks like this variable corresponds to multiple values from the flo_meas_name column

properties.name: units
properties.description: units of measurement

properties.name: inpatient_data_id
properties.description: unique data ID for data for backend

properties.name: dept_id
properties.description: ID of department where measurement was taken

properties.name: CRDW_FLO_GROUP
properties.description: flo group used by the CRI/CRDW to group measurement values

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'vitals_flowsheet' table.

properties.name: vitals_flowsheet.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'vitals_flowsheet' table.

nodes.name: medication
nodes.description: Information related to medication prescribed, dispensed or administered to the case.

properties.name: TREATMENT_PLAN_ID
properties.description: unique ID of treatment plan

properties.name: PLAN_RECORD_TYPE_C
properties.description: code for plan record type

properties.name: PLAN_STATUS_C
properties.description: code of plan status

properties.name: PLAN_STATUS_NAME
properties.description: name of plan status

properties.name: PLAN_VERSION
properties.description: plan version

properties.name: PLAN_CREATED_DATETIME
properties.description: day/time plan was originally created in Epic as a treatment plan

properties.name: PLAN_CREATOR_USER_ID
properties.description: ID of user who created plan in Epic

properties.name: PLAN_START_DATE
properties.description: day/time plan was started

properties.name: PLAN_DISCON_DATETIME
properties.description: day/time plan was discontinued

properties.name: PLAN_DISCON_USER_ID
properties.description: ID of user who discontinued plan for patient

properties.name: PLAN_DISCON_REASON_C
properties.description: code of reason why plan was discontinued

properties.name: PLAN_DISCON_REASON_NAME
properties.description: name of reason why plan was discontinued

properties.name: PLAN_NAME
properties.description: name of plan

properties.name: PLAN_DISPLAY_NAME
properties.description: display name of plan

properties.name: PROTOCOL_ID
properties.description: ID, name, and display name of protocol. Usually very similar to Plan Name

properties.name: PROTOCOL_NAME
properties.description: ID, name, and display name of protocol. Usually very similar to Plan Name

properties.name: PROTOCOL_DISPLAY_NAM
properties.description: ID, name, and display name of protocol. Usually very similar to Plan Name

properties.name: PROTOCOL_CONTACT_DATE_REAL
properties.description: protocol contact date

properties.name: PROTOCOL_CONTACT_NUM
properties.description: protocol contact number

properties.name: PROTOCOL_IS_RESEARCH_YN
properties.description: whether or not the protocol is a clinical trial

properties.name: PLAN_PROV_ID
properties.description: ID of provider who ordered plan

properties.name: REFERRAL_ID
properties.description: ID of provider who referred patient

properties.name: TREATMENT_GOAL_C
properties.description: code of treatment goal (curative vs. palliative vs. adjuvant, etc.)

properties.name: TREATMENT_GOAL_NAME
properties.description: name of treatment goal (curative vs. palliative vs. adjuvant, etc.)

properties.name: EPISODE_ID
properties.description: unique ID of episode (all Chemotherapy for the most part)

properties.name: EPISODE_TYPE_ID
properties.description: ID of the type of episode (all Chemotherapy for the most part)

properties.name: EPISODE_TYPE_NAME
properties.description: name of the type of episode (all Chemotherapy for the most part)

properties.name: PLAN_STARTING_CYCLE_NUM
properties.description: cycle number the plan starts on (some plans are continuations of previous plans and start at a later cycle)

properties.name: CYCLE_ID
properties.description: ID, name, and number corresponding to the treatment cycle. Cycles usually correspond to a few weeks. Some medications are only given every 3 weeks and others are given each week, so each cycle the patient receives the same medications in the same order, and this multi-week cycle is repeated X number of times in a single plan.

properties.name: CYCLE_NAME
properties.description: ID, name, and number corresponding to the treatment cycle. Cycles usually correspond to a few weeks. Some medications are only given every 3 weeks and others are given each week, so each cycle the patient receives the same medications in the same order, and this multi-week cycle is repeated X number of times in a single plan.

properties.name: CYCLE_NUM
properties.description: ID, name, and number corresponding to the treatment cycle. Cycles usually correspond to a few weeks. Some medications are only given every 3 weeks and others are given each week, so each cycle the patient receives the same medications in the same order, and this multi-week cycle is repeated X number of times in a single plan.

properties.name: CYCLE_START_DATE
properties.description: start date of the cycle

properties.name: CYCLE_STATUS_C
properties.description: code of the cycle's status (e.g. completed vs. started. Started usually means it was completed but sometimes this is not updated).

properties.name: CYCLE_STATUS_NAME
properties.description: name of the cycle's status (e.g. completed vs. started. Started usually means it was completed but sometimes this is not updated).

properties.name: TREATMENT_DAY_ID
properties.description: ID corresponding to the specific treatment day

properties.name: TREAT_DAY_CONTACT_DATE_REAL
properties.description: treatment day contact date

properties.name: TREATMENT_DAY_NAME
properties.description: name of treatment day relative to the start of the cycle

properties.name: DAY_NUM
properties.description: Day number relative to the start of the cycle (usually 1, 8, 15 which is the start of each week, if a cycle is 3 weeks for example).

properties.name: DAY_TYPE_C
properties.description: Day type code

properties.name: TREATMENT_DAY_TREATMENT_DATE
properties.description: actual day of treatment

properties.name: TREATMENT_DAY_PLANNED_DATE
properties.description: day that treatment was planned

properties.name: DAY_LENGTH
properties.description: length of treatment day

properties.name: DAY_STARTED_DATETIME
properties.description: day/time treatment was started

properties.name: DAY_STATUS_C
properties.description: code of status of day

properties.name: DAY_STATUS_NAME
properties.description: name of status of day

properties.name: CANCEL_DAY_REASON_C
properties.description: code of reason why treatment was cancelled

properties.name: CANCEL_DAY_REASON_NAME
properties.description: name of reason why treatment was cancelled

properties.name: DEFER_DAY_REASON_C
properties.description: code of reason why treatment was deferred

properties.name: DEFER_DAY_REASON_NAME
properties.description: name of reason why treatment was deferred

properties.name: DAY_GIVEN_EXTERNAL_REASON_C
properties.description: code of reason why treatment was given externally

properties.name: DAY_GIVEN_EXTERNAL_REASON_NAME
properties.description: name of reason why treatment was given externally

properties.name: ORDER_CATEGORY_C
properties.description: code of order category. Whether order corresponds to a pre/post-medication given, the chemotherapy regimen, a lab blood test, or other orders. Treatment Plan consists of everything, all orders, a patient may get as part of a plan.

properties.name: ORDER_CATEGORY_NAME
properties.description: name of order category. Whether order corresponds to a pre/post-medication given, the chemotherapy regimen, a lab blood test, or other orders. Treatment Plan consists of everything, all orders, a patient may get as part of a plan.

properties.name: PROC_ID
properties.description: the ID for procedures done as part of a plan, such as ordering a blood test

properties.name: MEDICATION_ID
properties.description: ID of medication. Each ID in MEDICATION ID should be unique to the specific medicine, route, dose, and frequency, you may be able to make a medication lookup table and relate it to the administration tables via the ID

properties.name: ORDER_DISCRETE_DOSE_MIN
properties.description: minimum dosages to be given as part of the order

properties.name: ORDER_DISCRETE_DOSE_MAX
properties.description: maximum dosages to be given as part of the order

properties.name: ORDER_DOSE_UNIT_C
properties.description: code of medication dose units

properties.name: ORDER_DOSE_UNIT_NAME
properties.description: name of medication dose units

properties.name: ORDER_TYPE_C
properties.description: code of order type (meds vs. labs vs. other). Similar to order category, but less specific

properties.name: ORDER_TYPE_NAME
properties.description: name of order type (meds vs. labs vs. other). Similar to order category, but less specific

properties.name: ORDERING_MODE_C
properties.description: code of ordering mode (inpatient vs. outpatient)

properties.name: ORDER_ID
properties.description: unique ID of order in EMR/Epic

properties.name: ENC_TYPE_C
properties.description: encounter type code

properties.name: ENC_TYPE
properties.description: encounter type

properties.name: ENC_date
properties.description: date of encounter

properties.description: day/time of hospital admissionfor this stay

properties.description: day/time of hospital discharge for this stay

properties.description: ID of department/physical location where patient was admitted

properties.description: name of department/physical location where patient was admitted

properties.description: ID of service admitting patient for this visit

nodes.name: lab_result
nodes.description: Measurements obtained from blood or other laboratory tests required by a medical professional. These will include lipids and lipid metabolism parameters, lipid oxidation markers, cytokines, adhesion molecules, nitric oxide, and hemostasis/fibrinolysis markers.

properties.name: enc_date
properties.description: date of encounter/lab test

properties.name: adm_date
properties.description: for hospital admissions, date of admission

properties.name: disc_date
properties.description: for hospital admissions, date of discharge

properties.name: order_dttm
properties.description: datetime of lab order

properties.name: result_dttm
properties.description: datetime of result

properties.name: order_proc_id
properties.description: unique ID of procedure corresponding to specific patient/encounter

properties.name: proc_code
properties.description: code of procedure ordered (one procedure corresponds to one lab test/blood draw, i.e. Complete Metabolic Panel)

properties.name: proc_desc
properties.description: description of procedure ordered (one procedure corresponds to one lab test/blood draw, i.e. Complete Metabolic Panel)

properties.name: lab_code
properties.description: code of specific lab value (i.e. Calcium, Potassium, etc.)

properties.name: lab_desc
properties.description: description of specific lab value (i.e. Calcium, Potassium, etc.)

properties.name: ord_value
properties.description: lab result value

properties.name: line
properties.description: which row/line the value appears in the report

properties.name: result_in_range_yn
properties.description: if result is in range (Y or N)

properties.name: result_flag
properties.description: a flag to designate high vs. low with regards to range

properties.name: reference_unit
properties.description: units of measurement for lab tests (i.e. mg/dL)

properties.name: HPV
properties.description: flag for HPV value (custom to 8980 database as we wanted to ID all HPV related patients)

properties.name: P16
properties.description: flag for P16 value

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'lab_result' table.

properties.name: lab_result.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'lab_result' table.

nodes.name: exposure
nodes.description: Standard questionnaire used to collect substance use and other exposure records from the subject

nodes.name: visit
nodes.description: This table contains events where subjects engage with the healthcare system for a duration of time. They are often also called “encounters”. Visits are defined by a configuration of circumstances under which they occur, such as (i) whether the patient comes to a healthcare institution, the other way around, or the interaction is remote, (ii) whether and what kind of trained medical staff is delivering the service during the Visit, and (iii) whether the Visit is transient or for a longer period involving a stay in bed.

properties.name: enc_date
properties.description: date of the encounter

properties.name: enc_type_c
properties.description: code of type of encounter (e.g. Appointment, Treatment, Surgery, Office Visit)

properties.name: encounter_type
properties.description: name of type of encounter (e.g. Appointment, Treatment, Surgery, Office Visit)

properties.name: ed_arrival_dttm
properties.description: date/time arrived to emergency department (ED)

properties.name: hosp_adm_dttm
properties.description: date/time of hospital admission

properties.name: hosp_dc_dttm
properties.description: date/time of hospital discharge

properties.name: department
properties.description: department in which encounter occurred (e.g. Radiation Oncology)

properties.name: disch_disp_c
properties.description: code of disposition of patient at hospital discharge (where discharged to)

properties.name: disch_disp
properties.description: disposition of patient at hospital discharge (where discharged to)

properties.name: dx_name
properties.description: diagnosis name corresponding to ICD code

properties.name: icd9_code
properties.description: ICD9 codes corresponding to diagnosis

properties.name: icd10_code
properties.description: ICD10 codes corresponding to diagnosis

properties.name: dx_rank
properties.description: each encounter can have multiple diagnoses associated with it and they are ranked, this is recorded here

properties.name: poa
properties.description: poa

properties.name: ADM_DATE
properties.description: admission date of encounter. For same day outpatient encounters, discharge date (DISC_DATE) should be the same.

properties.name: DISC_DATE
properties.description: discharge date of encounter. For same day outpatient encounters, admission date (ADM_DATE) should be the same

properties.name: CRDW_START_DATE
properties.description: CRI Data Warehouse start date

properties.name: CRDW_END_DATE
properties.description: CRI Data Warehouse end date

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'visit' table.

properties.name: visit.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'visit' table.

nodes.name: progress_note
nodes.description: Clinical progress notes are formal records that document a patient's clinical status, medical necessity, treatment progress, and plans for future care. They are used to communicate findings, opinions, and plans between healthcare professionals and to facilitate retrospective reviews of a case. These notes are essential for documenting treatment outcomes, legal purposes, and reimbursement.

properties.name: NOTE_ID
properties.description: Unique ID for note

properties.name: IP_NOTE_TYPE
properties.description: Type of note (Progress Note vs. Consult) & ID corresponding to note type

properties.name: IP_NOTE_TYPE_C
properties.description: ID corresponding to note type

properties.name: NOTE_STATUS_C
properties.description: code for status of note - Signed vs. Addendum

properties.name: NOTE_STATUS
properties.description: status of note - Signed vs. Addendum

properties.name: NOTE_CSN_ID
properties.description: note contact serial number

properties.name: DATE_OF_SERVICE_DTTM
properties.description: date & time of note creation

properties.name: AUTHOR_NAME
properties.description: Name of author of note

properties.name: AUTHOR_SERVICE_C
properties.description: code for service/department corresponding to author

properties.name: AUTHOR_SERVICE
properties.description: name of service/department corresponding to author

properties.name: FLAG_Service
properties.description: FLAG_Service

properties.name: NOTE_File_DTTM
properties.description: when note was filed

properties.name: Note_Narr
properties.description: raw text of progress note

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'progress_note' table.

properties.name: progress_note.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'progress_note' table.

nodes.name: radiology_report
nodes.description: Radiology Results & Reports written by radiologists for patients who had CT, MRI, PET scans, etc. performed. These reports are used for diagnosis and treatment of patients.

nodes.name: diagnosis
nodes.description: Data from the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

nodes.name: radiation_flowsheet
nodes.description: A document used to track the care provided to a patient during radiation therapy. Gives overview of a patient's condition, the treatment they're receiving, any medications or instructions given, observed side effects, and relevant social information.

properties.name: pat_enc_csn_id
properties.description: unique ID corresponding to patient encounter

properties.name: flo_meas_id
properties.description: id & name of radiation treatment variable relevant to visit, flo_group_name is display naming for flo_meas_name

properties.name: flo_meas_name
properties.description: id & name of radiation treatment variable relevant to visit, flo_group_name is display naming for flo_meas_name

properties.name: flo_group_name
properties.description: id & name of radiation treatment variable relevant to visit, flo_group_name is display naming for flo_meas_name

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_COURSE_ID
properties.description: ID corresponding to number course of RT treatment

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_PLAN_ID
properties.description: ID corresponding to specific radiation plan/protocol (i.e. 1-1 HN50Gy)

properties.name: Plan_ID
properties.description: ID corresponding to specific radiation plan/protocol (i.e. 1-1 HN50Gy)

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_TREATMENT_SITE
properties.description: body site planned to receive RT

properties.name: Treatment_Site
properties.description: body site planned to receive RT

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_TOTAL_FRACTIONS_FOR_CURRENT_PLAN
properties.description: integer corresponding to how many total fractions (individual radiation doses/treatments) are planned (i.e. 25)

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_FRACTION_FOR_CURRENT_PLAN
properties.description: integer corresponding to which fraction is being given (i.e. 7 of 20)

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_FRACTION_DOSE_FOR_CURRENT_PLAN
properties.description: Fraction dose expected to be given for this fraction aka specific treatment (usually 200 Gy)

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_TOTAL_DOSE_FOR_CURRENT_PLAN
properties.description: Total Dose Planned for Current Plan (i.e. 5000 Gy))

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_CUMULATIVE_DOSE
properties.description: Cumulative Dose Delivered (in Gy, i.e. 5200 Gy)

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_TOTAL_PRESCRIBED_DOSE
properties.description: Total Prescribed Dose that will be given once all treatments are complete (i.e. 7000 Gy aka 70 cGy. Total dose can be administered over multiple plans)

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_SIB_PLAN
properties.description: Type of radiation, a “boost”. SIB stands for simultaneous integrated boost, a radiation therapy technique that delivers a higher dose of radiation to a target volume (GTV) while keeping the dose to the surrounding area (CTV) at a normal level.

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_SIB_DOSE_CHARTED
properties.description: Dose to be given for boost

properties.name: RADONC_RS_LATERALITY
properties.description: designating left or right

properties.name: RADONC_RS_CONFIRM_PATIENT_ID
properties.description: flag to confirm correct patient ID

properties.name: Patients_ID
properties.description: flag to confirm correct patient ID

properties.name: RADONC_RS_CONFIRM_TREATMENT_SITE
properties.description: flag to confirm correct treatment site

properties.name: RADONC_RS_CONFIRMED_GANTRY_CLEARANCE
properties.description: Gantry clearance refers to the available space or distance between the patient table and the rotating arm (gantry) of a radiation therapy machine

properties.name: RADONC_RS_CONFIRM_TREATMENT_DEVICE
properties.description: flag to confirm treatment device

properties.name: RADONC_RS_CONFIRM_IMMOBILIZATION
properties.description: flag to confirm patient immobilized

properties.name: RADONC_RS_CONFIRM_IMAGES_REVIEWED
properties.description: flag to confirm review prior images were reviewed

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_OK
properties.description: Confirm OK to proceed

properties.name: RADONC_RS_TR_IMAGE_NEW
properties.description: flag to confirm new images taken

properties.name: device_id
properties.description: ID of device used for treatment

properties.name: recorded_time
properties.description: date/time of recording

properties.name: meas_value
properties.description: measurement value for row, corresponds to specific value recorded flo_meas_name variable

properties.name: meas_location
properties.description: location of measurement

properties.name: units
properties.description: measurement units

properties.name: inpatient_data_id
properties.description: specific ID of data for row to use for backend tracking

properties.name: dept_id
properties.description: department ID

nodes.name: treatment
nodes.description: Any medication, treatment or procedure taken by, prescribed to, or administered to a patient, including cancer-directed treatments, palliative or supportive care, non-cancer-directed prescription medications, and over-the-counter agents.

properties.name: Rx_Course_Desc
properties.description: each row of table corresponds to a treatment/diagnostic procedure. Course description marks if the row was part of a first or second course of treatment

properties.name: Rx_Start_Date
properties.description: Start date of treatment

properties.name: Rx_Type
properties.description: code (D, R, C, S, I, P) standing for treatment (Rx) types - diagnostic procedure, radiation, surgery, chemotherapy, immunotherapy, palliative therapy

properties.name: Rx_Type_Desc
properties.description: code (D, R, C, S, I, P) standing for treatment (Rx) type - diagnostic procedure, radiation, surgery, chemotherapy, immunotherapy, palliative therapy

properties.name: Rx_Code_Desc
properties.description: a specific description of the treatment/diagnostic procedure

properties.name: Treatment_This_Facility_Desc
properties.description: was the treatment done at UChicago

properties.name: First_Course_Dx
properties.description: Date of first diagnosis/staging and what procedure was used to make that diagnosis/staging

properties.name: Staging_Date
properties.description: Date of first diagnosis/staging and what procedure was used to make that diagnosis/staging

properties.name: First_Course_Dx_Staging_Proc_Hosp_Desc
properties.description: Date of first diagnosis/staging and what procedure was used to make that diagnosis/staging

properties.name: First_Course_Chemotherapy_Date
properties.description: start date of first chemo regimen (single agent vs. combination vs. none) (I would ignore that the “None” values mention an autopsy)

properties.name: First_Course_Chemotherapy_Hosp_Desc
properties.description: start description of first chemo regimen (single agent vs. combination vs. none) (I would ignore that the “None” values mention an autopsy)

properties.name: First_Course_Immunotherapy_Date
properties.description: start date confirming immunotherapy was ever given (None means that patient never got immunotherapy)

properties.name: First_Course_Immunotherapy_Hosp_Desc
properties.description: start description confirming immunotherapy was ever given (None means that patient never got immunotherapy)

properties.name: Date_of_First_Surgery
properties.description: date of first surgery received

properties.name: First_Course_Surg_Prim_Site_Hosp_Desc
properties.description: hospital location where first surgery received was performed

properties.name: First_Course_Scope_Reg_LN_Surg_Hosp_Desc
properties.description: how many lymph nodes were removed during first surgery

properties.name: Scope_Reg_LN_Surgery_Desc
properties.description: how many lymph nodes were removed during first surgery

properties.name: Date_RT_Started
properties.description: start date of RT

properties.name: Location_of_Radiation_Treatment_Desc
properties.description: bodily site of radiation treatment

properties.name: Radiation_Treatment_Volume_Desc
properties.description: volume of radiation treatment

properties.name: Regional_Treatment_Modality_Desc
properties.description: type of radiation treatment given

properties.name: Regional_Dose_cGy
properties.description: total dose delivered during radiation course (not counting boost)

properties.name: Boost_RT_Modality_Desc
properties.description: type of boost dose given

properties.name: Boost_Dose_cGy
properties.description: amount of boost dose given

properties.name: Subseq_Course_Rx_Summary
properties.description: uses Rx_Type codes to designate that patient received subsequent procedures/treatments after their first course. “R, C” means patient received subsequent radiation & chemo
